title: Hedge funds creep back into tech stocks after weeks of selling
description: Hedge funds last week bought the biggest tech stocks as well as those considered vulnerable to advances in artificial intelligence, said a note to clients from JPMorgan seen by Reuters on Tuesday.
content:
The world's most valuable technology stocks have suffered sharp declines this year after years of outsized gains, as investors question whether heavy on AI will generate sufficient returns to justify the lofty valuations.

description: First impressions matter more than ever in today’s digital-first world. title: Artificial Intelligence Goes Shopping, Creates Tax Challenges
description: Artificial intelligence is starting to move from recommending products to buying them. For tax, the question is, when an AI agent completes a sale, who is required to collect tax?
content:
Artificial intelligence is starting to move from recommending products to buying them.

title: Bears Again Target Teleperformance, One of AI’s First Victims
description: Speculators are again ramping up bets against call-center operator Teleperformance SE’s shares, wagering that the French company’s business will suffer further from the widespread adoption of artificial intelligence tools.
content:

title: Will AI decide your first job? What young professionals should know
description: Artificial intelligence is steadily becoming part of how young people are evaluated for jobs. As more students encounter AI-led interviews and assessments, understanding how these systems work is becoming increasingly important for first-time job seekers.
content: Artificial intelligence is no longer operating quietly behind the scenes of recruitment. From campus placements to early-career hiring, students are increasingly being assessed by AI-powered tools, sometimes even before a human recruiter reviews thei... [4424 chars]

title: Why forcing AI firms to report online threats may not be simple
description: A cybersecurity law expert says Canada could introduce laws requiring artificial intelligence companies to notify police of online threats, but the process would not be a simple one, since reporting every suspicion is "just not workable.
content:

title: friendly path to marine antifouling coatings
description: A comprehensive review examines how surface designs inspired by aquatic organisms such as shark skin, lotus leaves and coral can replace toxic conventional antifouling coatings. The authors highlight the need for multifunctional synergy and point to artificial intelligence as a key enabler for future developments.
content: Marine biofouling remains one of the most persistent challenges facing the shipping, aquaculture and offshore infrastructure sectors, causing increased drag, accelerated corrosion and considerable maintenance costs. Conventional antifouling coatings,... [2104 chars]
